title: Poster, 1997-19-150
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in blue lower left corner: They Are Here To  Stay / [in gray] St. Peter's Church has been in Manhattan / for well over a century, helping people cele-/ brate God's presence in the city. Many / Ne wYorkers are familiar with this unique / ministry of worship, jazz, music, and / theater. With a new facility, part of the / Citicorp Center and built on the same site  as the previous church, they will continue / to serve our beloved city. / 
2nd paragraph in gray: They are here to stay...helping people be / human among the skyscrapers of midtown. / That's their mission, their promise, and their dream.
erd paragraph in gray: Until the building is ready in the fall of / 1977 you can find them at Central Church, / 64th Street and Park Avenue. Sunday / services are at 8:30, 10:00, 12:30 and 5:00. During the week they are at 16 East / 56th Street, Telephone 753-4669
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Photographic reproduction of a view up through clouds to blue sky with a stylized maze modeled on a Greek Orthodox Cross in black suspended at center.  Blue at upper right quadrant, with white covering the remainder of the sheet.In gray, lower left on edge: the number 8. Three paragraphs of text in gray at lower left. In blue at lower right in block letters: SAINT / PETER'S / CHURCH and in light blue below: CITICORP / CENTER. Blue and white banding along lower edge of sheet.
